Author: Hermes#6934
Content: @vogelfreund  I don't see an issue from this side but still ...if you want to make a fresh launch of Hyperdex I will recommend first making sure that you have your seed written down and verify that you don't have any stuck or pending swaps. If you meet these requirements you can go ahead and erase the Hyperdex folder located in  %appdata% /Roaming/ path if usin Windows. After erasing this folder try launching the application again  from the latest version and see if that solves the issue.

Content: now it works... thanks for your time.

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content:
@cantptalblonit are you still experiencing the issue? It's most likey once of your currencies Electrum server that's gone down, HyperDEX can't really "go down" as it's all local. However it should move on to the next server if one isn't responding.

@sindresorhus are you able to look into this?

Author: sindresorhus#8187
Content: @cantptalblonit Can you open HyperDEX, go to the Help menu, click "Debug mode". HyperDEX will restart. Then go to the "Debug" menu and click "Show Settings" and then copy-paste the contents and send it to me as a private message. Then try to replace the `enabledCurrencies` entry with `"enabledCoins": ["KMD", "CHIPS"],`, save, restart HyperDEX and then try logging in again.
